title: System can be shut down without save file warnings
OB: When the system is shut down, there are no warnings or prompts to save any unsaved files or documents.
EB: When the system is shut down, a dialog box should appear asking the user if they want to save their file. The dialog box should have options for 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel'. If the user selects 'Cancel', the shutdown process should be halted.
SR:
1. Open any application and create a new document or make changes to an existing document.
2. Close the document without saving.
3. Click on the 'Shut Down' option in the system menu.
4. Verify that there is a dialog box asking if you want to save your file.
